definitions.definition: moving or tending away from a set course, standard route, plan, etc.

examples: His argument began to deviate significantly as the debate wore on.
The flight path was slightly deviating due to unexpected air traffic.

synonyms.definition: (When used in the context of ideas or plans) ceasing support for, following another course than expected.

antonyms.definition: (When used in the context of ideas or plans) continuously following a set course, standard route, plan.
